pt: {sc}show{/sc} {sc}manifest{/sc} {sc}evidence{/sc} {sc}evince{/sc} {sc}demonstrate{/sc} mean to reveal outwardly or make apparent. {sc}show{/sc} is the general term but sometimes implies that what is revealed must be gained by inference from acts, looks, or words.

pt.t: careful not to {it}show{/it} his true feelings

pt: {sc}manifest{/sc} implies a plainer, more immediate revelation.

pt.t: {it}manifested{/it} musical ability at an early age

pt: {sc}evidence{/sc} suggests serving as proof of the actuality or existence of something.

pt.t: a commitment {it}evidenced{/it} by years of loyal service

pt: {sc}evince{/sc} implies a showing by outward marks or signs.
{sc}demonstrate{/sc} implies showing by action or by display of feeling.

et: Latin {it}evincere{/it} to vanquish, win a point, from {it}e-{/it} + {it}vincere{/it} to conquer {ma}{mat|victor|}{/ma}
